title: Final Project
text:
This is a Quarto website.
To learn more about Quarto websites visit https://quarto.org/docs/websites.

library(readxl)
library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.2     ✔ readr     2.1.4
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.0
✔ ggplot2   3.4.2     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.2     ✔ tidyr     1.3.0
✔ purrr     1.0.1     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors

library(writexl)
library(stringr)
library(rstanarm)

Loading required package: Rcpp
This is rstanarm version 2.21.4
- See https://mc-stan.org/rstanarm/articles/priors for changes to default priors!
- Default priors may change, so it's safest to specify priors, even if equivalent to the defaults.
- For execution on a local, multicore CPU with excess RAM we recommend calling
  options(mc.cores = parallel::detectCores())



prem <- read_excel("EPL_Payroll.xlsx")


x <- prem |>
  select("Season", "Rk", "Squad", "Annual Wages", "Standing") |>
  mutate(annual = str_extract(`Annual Wages`, "\\$[0-9,]+")) |>
  mutate(annual = as.numeric(gsub("[$,]", "", annual))) |>
  select(-`Annual Wages`)


x

# A tibble: 200 × 5
   Season    Rk Squad          Standing    annual
    <dbl> <dbl> <chr>             <dbl>     <dbl>
 1   2022     6 Arsenal               2 129210591
 2   2022     7 Aston Villa           7 127888743
 3   2022    18 Bournemouth          15  48842265
 4   2022    20 Brentford             9  40845084
 5   2022    19 Brighton              6  48776174
 6   2022     3 Chelsea              12 241567629
 7   2022    12 Crystal Palace       11  84928703
 8   2022     8 Everton              17 107796661
 9   2022    13 Fulham               10  69066531
10   2022    17 Leeds United         19  62754708
# ℹ 190 more rows



fit_1 <- stan_glm(Standing ~ Rk,
                  data = x,
                  family = gaussian,
                  refresh = 0)


fit_1

stan_glm
 family:       gaussian [identity]
 formula:      Standing ~ Rk
 observations: 200
 predictors:   2
------
            Median MAD_SD
(Intercept) 3.3    0.6   
Rk          0.7    0.1   

Auxiliary parameter(s):
      Median MAD_SD
sigma 4.2    0.2
